Message:
Since then, I made it a habit
to write letters to
my parents every night.

At first, I just wrote
about my daily life.
But...as I kept writing,
different words
began to pour out.
“I want to see you both again.”

“I’m sorry I couldn’t
save you two that day.”

Tears I couldn’t shed before
began to fall,
one after another,
blurring the ink.

That day,
I’d worked together
with Mom to make
Dad’s favorite stew.

My dad had said those words
with a huge grin,
enthusiastically praising me.
I remember it all so clearly.

What I saw from inside the closet
is still burned into my memories.

But, the warm moments of
happiness I shared
with my parents
still live on within me.

I’d forgotten how
to smile and cry.

But, I hadn’t forgotten
that I was loved.
That’s the one thing
I could never ever forget.

I sealed each and every
letter I wrote,
inside envelopes
without any addresses.

Those letters, filled with
all of my deepest feelings,
contain the very essence
of the heart I lost.

I had to deliver them—
if I ever wanted to
move forward from that day.
